title: @Riot: D&D and other RPGs in the League of Legends Universe
body:
Would Riot ever be interested in creating a tabletop RPG guide for Runeterra or for the various territories within it?

Not only would a lot of players probably gravitate towards it (because of cross pollination between your fans and D&D fans) but I also imagine that it would be a good option financially because it requires less maintenance than a video-game with its servers (and other infrastructure) and periodic patches.

Feel free to discuss in the comments about the feasibility or merits of such a project, or even adventure ideas that could be used if such a project were ever undertaken.

replies.body:
A couple other Rioters and I got together and wrote a LoL adventure guide and mini-handbook for 5E as part of a [Thunderdome](http://thunderdome.riotgames.com/) project. It was fun to figure out races like Vastaya :D and I wrote a Hextech Engineer class based on Artificer

Ate a lot of humble pie making it though- its so difficult x_x we only got maybe 10-ish pages into it after 2-3 days? I can check in with the team and see if they mind me posting it if you'd like to use it as a spring board or something for your own campaign
OMG yes, please do ask them that for us! I would love to make use of it in campaigns with my friend group :D

As a D&D homebrewer myself, I feel your pain. It's not as easy as it looks (the only reason I've been so prolific over the years is my rather annoying attention to miniscule details that helps me navigate all the rules in the books and replicate them without thinking). 

5E is a good system though, and I'm glad you have friends at work who enjoy your hobby with you.

Riot has done so much to expand the lore... And you've created an inspiring world. I myself, am setting out to DM a campaign for my friends set in the world of League of Legends.
Did anything come of this?

Yee :3 Me too.

I bet it would be really fun to explore the Ebberon-like Piltover/Zaun, or experience what it would be like to be a magic user living near Demacia.
YES PLEASE! Finally we could get an updated map of all of Runeterra.
Haha yes that's part of why I'm asking, because it would enable GMs everywhere.

I'm actually in the process for making a campaign for my playgroups.
big part of DnD is being flexible so I'm working in the standard DnD races as well as LoL unique ones such as Vastaya
Also including more variant humans from the different regions.


Party will probably be initially dealing with either Freljord politics or Bilgewater piracy.  Once they level up some from those questlines I can bring them into bigger things with the major civilization centers.

Definitely custom making a bunch of creatures based on more monsterous champs, and stating out some of the champions higher level PC's
Also custom items....thinking I may create my own Darkin if a player expresses interest in becoming a hexblade warlock

I know this might not be what you are asking for but:

https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/mechs-vs-minions
That looks like a combination between chess and a card game. It's strategical and cool in it's own right, but it's not quite what I'm looking for. Are you familiar with tabletop RPGs like D&D?

> [{quoted}](name=HalcyonDweller,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Elj66h2l,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-02-05T20:13:18.956+0000)
>
> That looks like a combination between chess and a card game. It's strategical and cool in it's own right, but it's not quite what I'm looking for. Are you familiar with tabletop RPGs like D&D?

I played Werewolf: The Dark Ages... so yeah, i know that is Mech vs Minions not what you want.

However, I pointed out this game to show that Riot has already considered tabletop games in the past, so, its not impossible to think that they could make a Tabletop RPG in the future.

Mech VS Minions is a good example of what they can do.

I see, thank you! Yes I hope that Riot engages in future projects.

If they were to do something, what would you want to see from it? Would you want to interact with any particular lore from League? Or are you more interested in exploring Runeterra? Would you be excited by the prospects of meeting various factions or even characters from the lore?

> [{quoted}](name=HalcyonDweller,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Elj66h2l,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-05T20:38:16.111+0000)
>
> I see, thank you! Yes I hope that Riot engages in future projects.
> 
> If they were to do something, what would you want to see from it? Would you want to interact with any particular lore from League? Or are you more interested in exploring Runeterra? Would you be excited by the prospects of meeting various factions or even characters from the lore?

I don't like the idea of interacting with established champions, at least not a lot of them... Maybe hear one or two things about the important characters like Swain or Jarvan but no more than that. Mainly because it could affect the main lore of the LoL and people who will never play this new game would ignore those things.

So, im more of the kind of people who would be more interested in exploring the world, maybe just a single region or continent.

Ok, I understand where you are coming from with that. I too would like to explore regions. Champions could potentially serve as inspiration for stories but I certainly don't think that they should simply be included as much as possible. Obviously we don't want a story that was made just for the sake of including as many characters as possible, I agree and I think that would be cheap and disappointing.

I mean, it's not official, but you always have GURPS. There's a reason it has *General* and *Universal* in its name. Theoretically, you could make any champion, any item, and any character based off of it.

Then again, you'd have to have enough lore of the world to base it off of.

It's not entirely unreasonable for Riot to work with SJ Games for them to produce proper worldbooks, however...
That's another great idea! If it makes it more feasible for them to make such worldbooks if they were to collaborate with another studio then I'm all for it!
